trans-unit.source: Reviews of books in Amazon, taken from the amazon.com website by University of Pennsylvania researchers (<html></html>sentiment<html></html>).
trans-unit.target: Reviews of books in Amazon, taken from the amazon.com website by University of Pennsylvania researchers (<html></html>sentiment<html></html>).

trans-unit.source: See the research paper, “Biographies, Bollywood, Boom-boxes and Blenders: Domain Adaptation for Sentiment Classification” by John Blitzer, Mark Dredze, and Fernando Pereira; Association of Computational Linguistics (ACL), 2007.<html></html> <html></html>The original dataset has 975K reviews with rankings 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5.
trans-unit.target: See the research paper, “Biographies, Bollywood, Boom-boxes and Blenders: Domain Adaptation for Sentiment Classification” by John Blitzer, Mark Dredze, and Fernando Pereira; Association of Computational Linguistics (ACL), 2007.<html></html> <html></html>The original dataset has 975K reviews with rankings 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5.

trans-unit.source: The reviews were written in English and are from the time period 1997-2007.
trans-unit.target: The reviews were written in English and are from the time period 1997-2007.

trans-unit.source: This dataset has been down-sampled to 10K reviews.
trans-unit.target: This dataset has been down-sampled to 10K reviews.
